channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Some ants appear to alter their nests to prevent epidemics
item.description: Certain ants appear to alter their nest networks to prevent epidemics, offering inspiration for disease control interventions in the human world as well.
item.content:encoded: Certain ants appear to alter their nest networks to prevent epidemics, offering inspiration for disease control interventions in the human world as well.
item.dc:creator: Ari Daniel

item.title: The race for a governor in New Jersey could be close
item.description: The race for governor in blue New Jersey appears to be a dead heat between Democratic Rep. and former Navy pilot Mikie Sherrill and pro-Trump Republican and longtime N.J. politician Jack Ciattarelli.
item.content:encoded: The race for governor in blue New Jersey appears to be a dead heat between Democratic Rep. and former Navy pilot Mikie Sherrill and pro-Trump Republican and longtime N.J. politician Jack Ciattarelli.
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: Pakistan and Afghanistan agree to a ceasefire
item.description: Pakistan and Afghanistan agree to a ceasefire after unprecedented clashes, including strikes in Kabul and the deaths of three cricket players
item.content:encoded: Pakistan and Afghanistan agree to a ceasefire after unprecedented clashes, including strikes in Kabul and the deaths of three cricket players
item.dc:creator: Diaa Hadid

item.title: A new short sound logo for the Charlotte symphony
item.description: The Charlotte Symphony decided it wants a sonic logo, so it got a composer to write a seven-second piece of music for the orchestra.
item.content:encoded: The Charlotte Symphony decided it wants a sonic logo, so it got a composer to write a seven-second piece of music for the orchestra.
item.dc:creator: Eric Teel

item.title: When the government shut down threatened Halloween bathrooms, a town rallied
item.description: During its busiest time of year, "The Witch City" has come together to keep a national park site open — so all its costumed visitors can use the bathroom.
item.content:encoded: During its busiest time of year, "The Witch City" has come together to keep a national park site open — so all its costumed visitors can use the bathroom.
item.dc:creator: Andrea Shea

item.title: More Americans say violence might be necessary to get the country back on track
item.description: It's no secret that acrimony in America is high. And now, more Americans say violence might be necessary to get the country back on track.
item.content:encoded: It's no secret that acrimony in America is high. And now, more Americans say violence might be necessary to get the country back on track.
item.dc:creator: Domenico Montanaro

item.title: Outage at Amazon Web Services disrupts websites across the internet
item.description: Amazon's cloud computing service provides back-end support to many companies that operate online. When it has problems, so do they.
item.content:encoded:
Amazon's cloud computing service provides back-end support to many companies that operate online. When it has problems, so do they.

(Image credit: Noah Berger)
item.dc:creator: Jaclyn Diaz

item.title: Hollywood pushes OpenAI for consent
item.description: The latest version of OpenAI's Sora can quickly turn text prompts and simple images into studio quality videos, which left the entertainment industry deeply uneasy.
item.content:encoded:
The latest version of OpenAI's Sora can quickly turn text prompts and simple images into studio quality videos, which left the entertainment industry deeply uneasy.

(Image credit: Sora/Open AI/Annotation by NPR)
item.dc:creator: Mandalit del Barco

item.title: After years of shrinking, why is the gender pay gap getting wider?
item.description: After years of shrinking, the gender pay gap is widening. NPR's Mary Louise Kelly talks with Washington Post reporter Taylor Telford about why some women are leaving the workforce.
item.content:encoded: After years of shrinking, the gender pay gap is widening. NPR's Mary Louise Kelly talks with Washington Post reporter Taylor Telford about why some women are leaving the workforce.
item.dc:creator: Mary Louise Kelly

item.title: Clarissa Bitar composes songs of longing on ancient Middle Eastern instrument
item.description: NPR's Ailsa Chang talks with Clarissa Bitar about their new album, Bakhaf al-Layl, and how they are leaning into vocals after a long time spent not liking the sound of their voice.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Ailsa Chang talks with Clarissa Bitar about their new album, Bakhaf al-Layl, and how they are leaning into vocals after a long time spent not liking the sound of their voice.
item.dc:creator: Ailsa Chang
